image.altText: Elizabeth Dalman spreads her arms wide as she stands in front of ADT dancers

props.synopsis: Modern dance pioneer and rebel Elizabeth Dalman is returning to her roots in a new production by a leading Australian arts company.

title.children: 90-year-old rebel with a cause returns for new dance show

image.altText: A plume of sediment over a coastline with cliffs in the background.

props.synopsis: The EPA says a layer of clay was unexpectedly uncovered during works to raise a seawall south of Adelaide, which released a sediment plume into the water.

title.children: Sediment plume interrupts Christies Beach seawall works

image.altText: A man with a blonde beard wearing a blue stripy polo shirt and a baseball cap

props.synopsis: The father of a deceased newborn baby at the centre of a criminal neglect case told police in a recorded interview he had accidentally knocked over a bassinet.

title.children: Newborn had injuries consistent with 'high-impact car crash', court hears

image.altText: Young girl smiling and painting

props.synopsis: When Jung Yoon moved to Australia from South Korea in 1995, she had never encountered a person with a disability before, but that changed when she had her daughter Joanne. Now she is dedicating her life to help people with cognitive disability have better employment opportunities.

title.children: Inclusive hiring at the heart of project for people with cognitive impairment

image.altText: A drone shot of the Whyalla pellet plant.

props.synopsis: Energy and Mining Minister Tom Koutsantonis says iron mining job losses linked to GFG's Whyalla steelworks 'could have been avoided'.

title.children: SA Energy Minister slams GFG over 350 iron mining job losses

image.altText: A mouth in the background of a bunch of coriander.

props.synopsis: Some people in the food science world believe tastebuds can be retrained to enjoy divisive foods such as broccoli, brussels sprouts and coriander.

title.children: How you can retrain your tastebuds to like food you detest

image.altText: The cycling path along Adelaide's Southern Expressway.

props.synopsis: A South Australian teen has appeared in court after allegedly stringing fencing wire on a bike path — but he says he's innocent.

title.children: Teen denies twice setting wire traps on bike path despite alleged video

image.altText: Several people sit at outdoor tables in front of a white brick building in a plaza.

props.synopsis: Weekend and public holiday surcharges are becoming commonplace for many businesses. In a cost-of-living crisis, what do consumers think, and what are the rules?

title.children: Have you ever paid a public holiday or weekend surcharge? Here are the rules

image.altText: a stop sign at the level crossing

props.synopsis: More than 18,000 level crossings in Australia have little more than a stop sign to warn drivers to look out for freight trains hurtling towards them in the dark. A campaign is calling for a mandatory lighting solution.

title.children: 'It doesn't pass the pub test': Inside the debate to put mandatory lighting on trains

image.altText: A group of serious-looking men and women sit at a long wooden table in front of two Israeli flags.

props.synopsis: A statement from the Israeli PM's office, seen by the ABC, says the hostages held by Hamas could start being released as early as Sunday.

title.children: Gaza ceasefire deal clears major hurdle as Israeli security cabinet backs approval — as it happened

image.altText: A composite image of three men

props.synopsis: It appears as if both Joe Biden and Donald Trump are staking their foreign policy legacies on the Israel Hamas ceasefire agreement. And analysts believe both men were crucial to getting both sides to finally reach a deal.

title.children: 'Is that a joke?': How Trump's imminent return loomed over ceasefire talks

image.altText: Dutton, with a blonde woman in a blue suit jacket, talk in front of a supermarket deli counter

props.synopsis: The Coalition seems to be relying on the disgruntlement of voters with the government over tough times, rather than actively producing serious policies to do anything about it.

title.children: Dutton can't dodge the spotlight — or his unresolved problems

image.altText: A man in a green top and blue jeans rubbing his eyes with his forearm on a backdrop of rubble and blackened trees

props.synopsis: As firefighters continue to battle the blazes bearing down on Los Angeles, some residents left in their wake have begun assessing what's next.

title.children: 'Unimaginable heartbreak': counting the toll of the Los Angeles fires

image.altText: 2025-01-16T051121Z_752962051_RC2DACA44CP9_RTRMADP_3_USA-CHINA-TIKTOK-TRUMP (5)

props.synopsis: The social media giant is now due to be outlawed in America by Sunday unless its Chinese-based owner ByteDance sells the US version of the app

title.children: Trump to decide fate of TikTok in US after court upholds Biden's ban

image.altText: Australia's Aleksandar Vukic hitting a forehand with full power

props.synopsis: Aleksandar Vukic goes down in a thrilling grand slam match, while fan behaviour dominates on day six of the Australian Open.

title.children: Vukic falls short in five-set classic, fan behaviour in focus on day six

image.altText: A photo shows a plane flying toward the Eiffel Tower

props.synopsis: Pakistan's national airline has apologised for the advertisement, which is still online more than a week after it was first posted.

title.children: 'We truly apologise': Pakistan's national airline says sorry over Eiffel Tower advert

image.altText: storm front that hit Gungahlin, Canberra Jan 15

props.synopsis: Australia's summer weather is firing on all cylinders this weekend, with severe storms in the east set to make way for heatwaves in the west, and what could be the first cyclone to form near mainland Australia this season.

title.children: Fresh round of heatwaves expected to spread from west to east next week

image.altText: Woman and man leave Elizabeth Magistrates Court

props.synopsis: A 55-year-old woman who was allegedly driving the car that hit and killed a woman in Adelaide's north in the early hours of Tuesday morning has been released on bail.

title.children: Alleged hit-and-run driver released on bail after crash in Adelaide's north

image.altText: Woman in white dress standing behind lectern speaking.

props.synopsis: The WA Liberal leader's vow not to stand in front of the Aboriginal flag if elected premier has been slammed as "short-sighted" and "divisive" by the former federal Liberal minister for Indigenous affairs.

title.children: WA Liberal leader Libby Mettam refuses to stand in front of Aboriginal flag

image.altText: People standing on the beach behind tents in central Gaza.

props.synopsis: Palestinians in Gaza could soon leave their makeshift camps and tents behind under a ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas. But after 15 months of war, many will be returning to rubble where their homes once stood.

title.children: Before and after images show what Gazans will be returning home to

image.altText: Lisa standing in grassland, with native trees behind her.

props.synopsis: In the middle of Tasmania sits a 5,000-hectare property once used for sheep grazing. But when the sheep farmers left, an unlikely buyer moved in.

title.children: Billionaire couple focus their fortune on conservation — and profit

image.altText: A model of a brain

props.synopsis: About 2,000 people in Australia are affected by Huntington's disease, a fatal and incurable condition that affects the nervous system that results in the death of brain cells.

title.children: Research reveals 'ticking DNA clock' behind fatal disease

image.altText: A graphic depicts traditional Korean hanbok alongside a Chinese garment and the War Memorial building

props.synopsis: A garment that appears to be of Chinese origin is currently displayed in front of the South Korean flag at the Australian War Memorial — something Korean Australians are demanding is rectified.

title.children: Australian War Memorial urged to remove 'Chinese' dress from Korean War display

image.altText: A headshot of Imran Khan in front of a flag

props.synopsis: Khan is accused of accepting a gift of land from a real estate tycoon in exchange for laundered money when he was in power.

title.children: Pakistani court sentences ex-prime minister Imran Khan to 14 years in prison

image.altText: A Chinese man posing topless while wearing black shorts in a gym with a wall decorated with balloons

props.synopsis: Chinese authorities have reportedly rescued a Chinese model who was caught up in a human-trafficking ring in Myanmar's lawless borderlands.

title.children: Chinese model rescued from scam centre in Myanmar

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: dog flickr

props.synopsis: The five-week-old died from fatal injuries after a mauling from a family pet in the Central Coast in 2021.

title.children: NSW coroner calls for dog owners to be licensed after baby mauled to death

image.altText: Debris from the roof is collected in a grand stand at a stadium

props.synopsis: A vinyl sheet of roofing has fallen into the stands at the SCG amid wild winds that blew across the ground before the Sydney Sixers' Big Bash League clash with the Sydney Thunder.

title.children: Debris falls from SCG roof as wild weather washes out BBL clash

image.altText: Exterior of pizza shop with sunset in background

props.synopsis: A summer police operation in the small NT town of Katherine has led to 200 arrests in just six weeks.

title.children: Almost 200 arrested over six-week police blitz in NT outback town

image.altText: Mother charged infant

props.synopsis: The 34-year-old, who allegedly poisoned her daughter and recorded her physical and emotional suffering to elicit donations, appeared in court on Friday.

title.children: Lawyer for influencer accused of torturing baby asks for protective custody

image.altText: SpaceX Starship on launch pad

props.synopsis: A SpaceX prototype has failed in space after its launch caused weeks of Qantas flight delays.

title.children: SpaceX prototype fails in space after launch caused string of Qantas delays

image.altText: Rider Daniel Sanders on his motorcycle, one wheel in the air, during a rally

props.synopsis: Daniel Sanders has raced into the history books, becoming only the second Australian to triumph at the Dakar Rally.

title.children: Sanders becomes second Aussie to win famous Dakar Rally

image.altText: IMAGE Stallone, Voight, Gibson composite

props.synopsis: President-elect Donald Trump has tapped Sylvester Stallone, Mel Gibson and Jon Voight to be his "eyes and ears" in Hollywood.

title.children: Trump names trio of action stars as Hollywood 'special ambassadors'

image.altText: Apollo astronaut Captain Eugene Cernan walking on the moon.

props.synopsis: With a number of commercial missions heading to the Moon this year, heritage organisations are concerned about potential damage to historic sites.

title.children: Moon added to list of threatened cultural sites amid boom in space exploration

image.altText: Ash Gardner smiles and holds her bat and helmet up after reaching a century

props.synopsis: Australia is one win away from retaining the Women's Ashes after completing a thumping 86-run win over England in the third ODI in Hobart.

title.children: Gardner ton and classic catch put Australia one step away from Women's Ashes
